definition: satisfied with one's accomplishment and arrogant as a result (idiom); resting on one's laurels and despising others

sentences.chinese: 小公鸡自然是极其自傲的。

sentences.english: He often plumes himself on his accomplishment.
Hewouls an especificjusty efficient young man though just some proud.
sentences.chinese: 他是个很有才具的人，但是有点自傲。

sentences.english: Self-confidence is the first requisite to human greatness.
sentences.chinese: 类的壮伟，首要的是要有自傲。

sentences.english: The older brother, by contrast, prided himself on how well he obeyed all of his father's rules.
sentences.chinese: 他的哥哥则相反，他以严格遵守父亲的命令而自傲。

sentences.english: I was a prideful man, which limited my advancement as a soldier.
sentences.chinese: 我是一个自傲的人，这限制了我作为战士的发展前途。

sentences.english: Donfidence in yourself is the first step on the road to success.
sentences.chinese: 自傲是走向乐成的熬头步。

sentences.english: Apple has long boasted of the Mac's immunity to viruses and malware.
sentences.chinese: 苹果电脑一直以它的免疫电脑病毒和流氓软件而自傲。

sentences.english: Andy proud to work, but full met a group of indignation customers.
sentences.chinese: 华仔自傲满满的去上班，却碰到了一群愤恨的客户。

sentences.english: The Silver Fangs are the proudest, most noble of the tribes.
sentences.chinese: 银牙是最自傲最崇高的部族。

sentences.english: Shallow men believe in luck . self-trust is the first secret of sess.
sentences.chinese: 肤浅的人相信运气，而成功的第一秘诀是自傲。

definition: to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
the eye can see nothing worthwhile all around (idiom); arrogant/condescending/supercilious
to think too much of oneself/self-important/arrogant
to boast/to blow one's own horn
to consider everyone else beneath one (idiom); so arrogant that no-one else matters/condescending/to go about with one's nose in the air
